newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Seoul stocks seen rising on hopes for economy.
newsitem.headline: Seoul stocks seen rising on hopes for economy.

text.p: Seoul stocks are expected to rise on Monday with representative industrials in the spotlight backed by improving economic indicators, brokers said.
"The market will remain strong as some macro-economic indicators economy showed a sign of improvements over the weekend," said Cha Hee-gun at Sunkyong Securities.
The industrial output grew 6.1 percent year-on-year in May from a 10.0 percent rise a year earlier. May inventory growth was the lowest in 20 months at 11.7 percent on the year.
The composite stock index rose 8.46 points at 746.89 on Saturday.
"The index will rise up to the 750-760 level," Cha said. "Institutional investors in particular are expected to support the index for their firs-half investment performances."
But loan defaults by Tae Sung Machinery and Construction and Keum Kang Leather Co would pressure investors to shy away from smaller companies, brokers said.
